Class LockedDoor

java.lang.Object
GameObject
Tile
LockedDoor
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlueDoor, PinkDoor, RedDoor, YellowDoor
public abstract class LockedDoor extends Tile
Abstract class representing a locked door on the game map. This class extends the Tile class and handles the locking mechanism and unlocking process based on keys in the player's keychain.
Version:
1.0.2
Author:
Ollie Jones

  • Constructor Details

    • LockedDoor

      public LockedDoor(String pathToSprite, GridPosition gridPositionposition)
      Constructs a LockedDoor with a specified sprite and grid position.
      Parameters:
      pathToSprite - The file path to the sprite image representing the door.
      gridPosition - The grid position of the door on the map.

  • Method Details

    • isLocked

      public boolean isLocked()
      Gets the locked status of the door.
      Returns:
      true if the door is locked, false otherwise.

    • update

      public void update(Map map) throws InterruptedException
      Updates the locked door on the map. This method may be overridden in subclasses, but currently does nothing.
      Specified by:
      update in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      map - The map where the door is located.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted during execution.

    • unlock

      public abstract void unlock(Map map, ArrayList<Key> keychain)
      Abstract method to unlock the door. This method should be implemented by subclasses to define how the door can be unlocked using the player's keychain.
      Parameters:
      map - The map where the door is located.
      keychain - The list of keys available in the player's keychain.

    • getColour

      public KeyColour getColour()
      Gets the color of the key required to unlock the door.
      Returns:
      The KeyColour representing the color of the key needed.
